intro: Jatropha melanosperma, commonly known as the black-seeded jatropha, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, spherical fruits that contain seeds with a dark, glossy coating. It is often found in dry, disturbed habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions. The species is also noted for its potential in ecological restoration due to its hardy nature and ability to grow in poor soils.
